channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.dc:creator: Jordan Baker
item.description: Parents and educators are split over a plan to send students back to school for one day a week, with some saying it will be too complicated, and others too short.
item.title: Confusion, division and relief at plan to send NSW school students back to class

item.dc:creator: Hamish Hastie
item.description: From March 28 to April 4, as social distancing rules hit their crescendo, WA shaved 5.6 per cent from its workforce, slightly above the national average of 5.5 per cent.
item.title: WA lost 5.6 per cent of jobs within a week, ABS figures reveal

item.dc:creator: Nick Toscano
item.description: Australians seeking ultra-cheap petrol across the country following the stunning crash in crude oil prices are being cautioned not to get their hopes too high.
item.title: Ultra-cheap petrol not guaranteed despite oil price crash

item.dc:creator: Heather McNeill
item.description: The decision comes after the State Administrative Tribunal in 2018 found Mr Rayney guilty of professional misconduct for secretly recording his wife's conversations before her death, and then lying to a Magistrate about it.
item.title: Lloyd Rayney's 'tendency to lie' sees him banned from practising law

item.dc:creator: Sarah Keoghan
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should call (not visit) your GP or ring the national Coronavirus Health Information Hotline on 1800 020 080.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: Donald Trump to suspend immigration into US as COVID-19 economic fallout hits Virgin Australia, oil price, Australian death toll at 72

item.dc:creator: Heather McNeill
item.description: ChemCentre fibres expert Rees Powell is going through the eight 1996 Holden Commodore VS Series 1 station wagon carpet fibres allegedly found in Ciara Glennon's hair.
item.title: Claremont killer trial LIVE: Fibre expert moves to carpet fibres found in Ciara Glennon's hair

item.dc:creator: Erin Pearson
item.description: Natasha Pawlak was seven when she boarded her first Boeing 747 bound for Europe with her Polish grandfather. The trip sparked a love of aviation that is still as strong today.
item.title: 'It's part of who I am': Virgin Australia staff devastated as future hangs in the balance

item.dc:creator: David Crowe
item.description: A refugee living in detention is taking the Morrison government to court to secure his release because he fears he will catch the coronavirus.
item.title: Refugee applies for release from detention to avoid coronavirus

item.dc:creator: Adam Carey
item.description: Haileybury has abandoned moves to stand down some of its teachers without pay as a way to cut costs during the COVID-19 pandemic after a backlash from parents.
item.title: Independent schools back down on teacher stand-downs

item.description: Parts of China, Singapore and Japan are imposing new restrictions against a second wave of infections.
item.title: Tablet interactive: Coronavirus outbreak

item.dc:creator: Dana McCauley
item.description: The government is ramping up efforts to convince Australians to download its COVID-19 tracing app as it pushes to "suppress or eliminate" the coronavirus.
item.title: Commonwealth to have 'no access' to data from coronavirus tracing app: PM

item.dc:creator: Mike Foley
item.description: Energy Minister Angus Taylor says Australia can capitalise on depressed energy markets to deliver a “strategic economic stimulus”.
item.title: Gas to fire economic recovery and capitalise on cheap oil prices

item.dc:creator: Rachel Clun
item.description: With 1755 of the state’s 2969 cases reporting they are now free of symptoms, the NSW figure is slightly lower than the national recovery tally of 65 per cent.
item.title: Most NSW COVID-19 cases recover within three weeks, data shows

item.dc:creator: Stuart Layt
item.description: A day after recording zero new virus cases, Queensland saw a handful of new ones and a potential cluster forming, a stark reminder the virus threat has not lifted
item.title: Cairns cluster shows danger of reducing virus efforts, experts say

item.dc:creator: Lucy Battersby
item.description: The ASX fell 2.5 per cent again on Tuesday after Virgin went into administration and volatility re-emerged on global markets.
item.title: ASX drops further as RBA predicts worst recession in 90 years

item.dc:creator: Sumeyya Ilanbey
item.description: Deputy Commissioner Shane Patton said people had become "by and large" compliant with the stage-three rules since their introduction at the end of March.
item.title: Police using more discretion as COVID-19 fines drop, top cop says

item.dc:creator: Sam Phillips
item.description: Some of the biggest names in Australian rugby history have united to sign an extraordinary letter calling for change at the top of Rugby Australia.
item.title: Former Wallabies skippers sign letter calling for change at top of RA

item.description: Fiji Rugby Union chairman Francis Kean has allegedly been recorded using homophobic language while in charge of his country's prison service.
item.title: World Rugby probes claims of homophobia against Fiji chair Francis Kean

item.dc:creator: Sam McClure
item.description: The AFL has hub plans for all six states plus the ACT and the Northern Territory.
item.title: Hubs to be ready across the country

item.description: Adelong has not been immune to the coronavirus upheaval but trainer Brad Widdup believes the TAB Handicap (1100m) is a suitable return for his four-year-old mare.
item.title: Adelong way down path to Canterbury conquest despite COVID-19 chaos

item.dc:creator: Fergus Hunter
item.description: Australia Post will reduce letter deliveries to every second day in metropolitan areas under a major overhaul during the COVID-19 crisis.
item.title: Australia Post reduces letter deliveries as it faces a decade's worth of disruption

item.dc:creator: Eryk Bagshaw
item.description: Officials in Seoul say they have not seen any unusual activity in North Korea, following reports North Korean dictator Kim Jong-un was gravely ill.
item.title: South Korea plays down reports Kim Jong-un is near death

item.dc:creator: Angus Thompson
item.description: An eastern suburbs council that opened its beaches for exercise has been forced to tighten restrictions again ahead of forecast hot weather.
item.title: 'Take some ownership': police, lifeguards move on crowds at Coogee

item.description: A Queensland man systematically raped and burned a woman during three weeks of drug-induced violence that grew more brutal as her injuries worsened.
item.title: Queensland man tortured woman for weeks

item.dc:creator: Bianca Hall
item.description: One of Australia's leading bat experts says an MPs demand that Melbourne's largest bat colony be relocated or thinned is a 'terrible idea'.
item.title: Expert bats away call for 'ridiculous' cull of Yarra Bend flying foxes

item.description: The mass exodus tradition, locally known as mudik will not be allowed to proceed at the end of the Muslim fasting month, President Joko Widodo said.
item.title: Indonesia bans Ramadan mass exodus tradition to curb coronavirus spread

item.dc:creator: Shane Wright
item.description: Data shows 800,000 jobs disappeared in three weeks as shutdowns aimed at stopping coronavirus hit the economy.
item.title: Job disaster - 800,000 jobs go in three weeks amid Depression warning

item.dc:creator: Dominic Powell
item.description: The supermarket giant is preparing for a sustained spike in online demand, which could see e-commerce sales soar to nearly $3 billion by next year.
item.title: Woolworths doubles online capacity to capture $3 billion sales shift

item.description: Everything you need to know to pick a winner on an eight-race card at Canterbury.
item.title: Race-by-race tips and preview for Canterbury on Wednesday

item.dc:creator: Matt Dennien
item.description: Emergency services, including critical car paramedics, were called to the scene in Caboolture about 12.45pm on Tuesday. Nobody else was injured in the incident.
item.title: Motorcycle rider dead after collision with reverse-parking car

item.dc:creator: Nick Toscano
item.description: Listed oil and gas producer Oil Search has seen its revenues slip in the first quarter of 2020 as the industry tackles unprecedented drop in demand.
item.title: Oil Search boss warns of historic volatility as crude prices crash

item.dc:creator: Danielle Cronin
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should contact (not visit) your GP, local hospital or 13HEALTH.
item.title: Coronavirus LIVE Queensland updates: death toll stands at 6 and national cabinet meets today

item.dc:creator: Dana McCauley
item.description: Scott Morrison has urged aged care operators to allow visitors for the sake of residents' wellbeing, saying the advice was never to "shut people off".
item.title: Don't lock aged care residents away from their families, PM says

item.dc:creator: Elizabeth Knight
item.description: Two of Australia’s largest companies, Wesfarmers and Macquarie Group, are said to be contenders in the bidding process to recapitalise Virgin Australia. They join a long list.
item.title: Bidders line up as Virgin clears the debt

item.dc:creator: Andrew Wu
item.description: Kevin Roberts has indicated the governing body will ask the players to take an additional pay cut to help the game out of its financial crisis.
item.title: 'Creative solutions': Cricket Australia chief flags player pay cuts

item.dc:creator: Genevieve Rota
item.description: No matter what goes on in the world, reality TV finds a way to persist.
item.title: Is it voyeurism, boredom or both that keeps us tuning in to reality TV?

item.dc:creator: Michael Gleeson
item.description: Western Bulldogs wingman Lachie Hunter has been hit with a four-match suspension and fined a maximum $5000 for his role in a drink-driving incident last week.
item.title: Bulldog Lachie Hunter banned for four matches

item.dc:creator: Darren Gray
item.description: GrainCorp's new boss says the company is well placed to bounce back from the devastating drought, as some farmers seed their biggest grain crops in at least six years.
item.title: GrainCorp eyes rebound as farmers plant biggest crops in six years

item.description: As a woman in the animal protection movement, it is clear to me that Carole Baskin was the victim of a kind of violence I have also encountered.
item.title: Everyone's talking about Tiger King but not about its most important insight

item.dc:creator: Sally Rawsthorne
item.description: While some will be repatriated by plane, crew aboard say they were told that the disaster-plagued ship will take others home.
item.title: 57 down, hundreds to go: NSW readies to repatriate Ruby Princess crew

item.dc:creator: Eryk Bagshaw
item.description: Beijing shuts down its diplomat district after infections are brought back into China, while Singapore and Japan grapple with a second surge.
item.title: 'The greatest challenge': Asia catches coronavirus' second wave

item.description: Collingwood star Darcy Moore tells the Real Footy podcast what it's like to play on Joe Daniher in an Anzac Day game, why he defies instructions to spoil more, one thing he's enjoying about the AFL shutdown and more.
item.title: Real Footy podcast: 'You've got to fight fire with fire'

item.dc:creator: Melissa Cunningham
item.description: A clinical study led by Melbourne’s Doherty Institute aims to treat every patient hospitalised with coronavirus infection over the next 18 months, in a bid to keep them out of intensive care.
item.title: COVID-19 medical trial to treat thousands with HIV, malaria drugs

item.description: Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau said on Monday his government would move ahead on the gun control legislation he promised during last year's election campaign after the shooting.
item.title: Death toll from Canada's mass shooting rises, Trudeau pledges action on guns

item.description: The best photos from the international wire agencies as chosen by our picture editors
item.title: Gallery: The best photos from around the world

item.dc:creator: Sherryn Groch
item.description: The virus can stay infectious in the air for more than 12 hours, research out of four major US laboratories has found, but it's unclear how much will make you sick.
item.title: 'Very unusual': Coronavirus can last longer in air than first thought

item.dc:creator: Toby Crockford
item.description: Zach Robba's father said the ocean gave his family great pleasure through boating and island adventures, but it also delivered great pain.
item.title: Family farewells Queensland ranger killed after shark attack

item.dc:creator: Anna Patty
item.description: Uber has been handed a major victory in the Fair Work Commission after it defeated an unfair dismissal claim with the finding drivers are not employees.
item.title: Uber scores major victory in argument driver was not an 'employee'

item.dc:creator: Jewel Topsfield
item.description: When the Chakraborty family applied to become Australian citizens they never imagined they would pledge their loyalty to the country from their Docklands apartment.
item.title: House party: Melbourne first council to host online citizenship ceremonies

item.dc:creator: Anthony Galloway
item.description: Prime Minister Scott Morrison has backed calls for a review into the coronavirus and the World Health Organisation's handling of the global pandemic.
item.title: Morrison pushes for global review into handling of COVID-19
